intro: Rubus pallidus var. jourdesianus, commonly known as the Jourdesian bramble, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and clusters of white to pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, edible berries that are often used in local cuisines. It thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil and partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
